topic.title: ZeroNet uploaded files means duplicity on a HDD
topic.body:
Hello,

if i decide to share/seed some of my files (example on ZeroUp, KopyKate, ZeroLSTN), the files will be copied over to the zeronet directory which means it will be on two spots on the HDD which is not effective, especially when one want to share large amount of data. I know Windows has some symbolic linking software like mklink https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc753194(v=ws.10).aspx or [Dirlinker](https://archive.codeplex.com/?p=dirlinker)
But more automation is needed, i found http://rayburnsoft.net/dc.html which may find same files and replace duplicate files with symbolic/hard links, but in my case it not worked.

What is hard link:
"Hard link: a mirrored copy of a target file that does not take up additional space on the hard drive. Cannot span across partitions or drives. Will still work if the original file is moved or deleted."

Anyone tried some de-duplication/symlinking SW it or know about other (preferably automatic) solution to this issue?

For Linux, there are certainly scripts/commands to do the linking and automate it: https://superuser.com/a/969355/590209

-------------------
Update: I have some news,

[Duplicate commander](http://rayburnsoft.net/dc.html) worked good, except when i checked KopyKate, videos shown unrecognized MIME type, apparently ZeroNet or KopyKate does not work with resulting .symlink files. It does not follow windows links (.symlink files) and hardlinks are not possible between different HDDs though both have NTFS system. So if you have duplicates across one drive only, you may try to use this app and create hard links, maybe ZeroNet will "follow them".

[NoClone](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GNTAKCimBv5xEnt7QvkDn8sTkEPj7ZYTL/?NoClone) is paid SW and it works good to find and auto-replace duplicity with shortcuts or hardlinks, but only hardlinks works in zeronet.

[jdupes](https://github.com/jbruchon/jdupes/releases) Windows command line tool should also be working if your duplicate files are both on one drive, not across multiple drives.
Copy jdupes.exe to C:\Windows
Then open command line: Win.+R or click start menu and then type cmd

Show duplicates:
jdupes --recurse --size C:\ZeroNet\data\18Pfr2oswXvD352BbJvo59gZ3GbdbipSzh C:\Videa

Replace them with hard links:
jdupes --recurse --linkhard C:\ZeroNet\data\18Pfr2oswXvD352BbJvo59gZ3GbdbipSzh C:\Videa

(Backup the source folder (C:\ZeroNet... one) before executing. Check --noprompt flag.)

----
Even if ZeroNet/KopyKate follow .symlink, there later can be problem once you move destination files to different location. How to bulk [update many symlinks](https://www.google.com/search?q=symlink+editor+OR+manager) burried deep in ZeroNet folder structures?! I think i will have to keep Zeronet on same drive on which are original files and then try hardlinks or get a NAS that features some automatic file de-duplication. FreeNAS that is using ZSF filesystem does it or Rockstor, but these require machine with at least 8GB of free RAM in order for deduplication mechanism to work.

topic.title: Does .bit mean a single point of failure?
topic.body:
Hello,

if i promote my site by mentioning its .bit address and then will not renew the .bit name, people will fail to access my site and many will NOT even find the zite "internal"/real address (here is how to find it: http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1516319766_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS )?

From decentralization and distributed point of view it appear to me like it is better NOT to use .bit name and promote site with internal address like 127.0.0.1:43110/15psKMf7iWZNdos5iKNQRTwu31hXEM9gFi ?

At https://wiki.namecoin.org/index.php?title=Register_and_Configure_.bit_Domains they say registration is around 0.01 NMC (Namecoin) and +6 months renewal is 0.005 NMC, this is very low price, under 10 cents probably (https://coinmill.com/NMC_USD.html), half-solution can be if one renew for lets say 500 years (rougly $100 at that price), but unsure if that is possible.

If there are any work arounds? I appreaciate if you explain it. Thank You

Until zeronet [fix this issue](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1832), here is some relevant reading:

- This help you to manually edit all your post to **[use real addresses](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1543955963_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS)** instead of .bit: **[How to bulk edit all your username posts, comments on a site like ZeroTalk or other](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1546089919_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+bulk+edit+all+your+username+posts+comments+on+a+site+like+ZeroTalk+or+other)**

- This help you to **setup auto-redirect of .bit to real addresses**: [Automatic redirect URL to different URL/domain in web browser](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1546086964_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Automatic+redirect+URL+to+different+URL+domain+in+web+browser)

topic.title: Discover .bit site real zeronet address and from where it was cloned.
topic.body:
This is probably known to experienced users, but here i put it for everyone. The tutorial on how to:
- discover zeronet address of the site of which we know only its .bit address
- discover address of the original site from which the clone (cloned site) was made/created
- discover where some site's files are stored on PC

Quick video tutorial: http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1516319766_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS

In text mode, it is like this:

--Discover real zeronet address of the .bit--
When you visit .bit site, right click somewhere and select to show source code. There on the bottom you will find real zeronet address. Another way is under zite menu (the "0" button in right top corner)

--Discover real zeronet address of the expired .bit domain--
If the .bit domain was not renewed, you probably can no longer access the zite via .bit address, but despite that, zite can be accessible under its zeronet address if you know it. To discover this address, you can access [ZeroHello](http://127.0.0.1:43110) and search there for the .bit domain name if you can find its real address. If can not and you know you already visited this .bit domain (and thus have the zite stored on your PC) then on ZeroHello next to the zeronet logo (top left corner) click dots. Click "Show data directory" and then use the search function of your file manager/your OS to search for "domainnamehere.bit" inside all files in that zeronet data directory and its subdirectories. Better to refine search to look only in .json or content.json files. You should find a directory that match the zite address. On Linux: maybe try command: grep -Ri "domainname.bit" /path/to/zeronet/data/*/content.json

--Discover cloned site original--
Go to [ZeroHello](http://127.0.0.1:43110) and next to the zeronet logo (top left corner) click dots. Click "Show data directory" and then use the search function of your file manager/your OS to search for the zite address in that directory. Inside zite directory you find, open content.json and inside, you should find from which zite this one was cloned

topic.title: How to mute/hide zeronet user's posts/content from all zeronet sites
topic.body:
Hello, here is the way on how to mute/hide (block/remove) content/posts of certain zeronet user so it do not appear on any zeronet site.

This will not delete the content, just hide it.

1. Copy the zeronet username
2. Open ZeroID ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit/ )
3. click to Search in user database and paste the username
4. click mute button
5. to remove muting, go to ZeroHello, click three dots next to the zeronet logo, select "Manage muted users"

Source of this tutorial is this video: http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1515834496_1J58Rie679DVSuKB1iDyFFTbzmaMaY2bt2

topic.title: Issue with user account quota on abandoned sites
topic.body:
Hello,

when i register on a ZeroTalk cloned site and after a few months i reach 50kB quota on published content. Once the zite gets abandoned by its owner, i can no longer post unless i delete my old content which makes no solution, also creating new user account somehow will make me loose track of a responses to my old account posts. Being unable to post new content because of reached limit on admin abandoned zites i see as a serious problem. Am i wrong?

On ZeroTalk i am almost reaching the quota and even site is not abandoned, i waited some time to have my limit slightly increased manually by @nofish . I do not think this is clever to leave quota increasing and spam management only to one person who will die (everyone will). Instead there should be some mechanism (enabled by default) where established users will be UNable or hardly be able to reach posting quota on sites where admin abandoned it.

I propose following solutions:

A) Automatically increase user/s quota as time goes. Example increase to be equal to one or two average comments daily.
B) zeroid.bit will introduce functions that will allow zites to evaluate if user is a bot or quality user (age of account, daily post count, up/down votes ratio, number of flagged/reported posts) to determine if the user's quota should be automatically increased. Users rated as high quality may approve other users request to increase quota or even help clean the zite from spam.
C) introduce anti-bot system (series of questions/antibot tasks to confirm certain actions like muting user, flagging post as inappropriate/SPAM) based on this, some users can be identified as a likely spammer, other user can be rated as a not spammer and qualify for automatic or half automatic quota increase.

topic.title: One ID provider but with different name across multiple zites, how that work?
topic.body:
Hello,

in [this topic](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1517337097_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) i was asking how to add more ID providers to a zite. And i got helpful advices that worked to setup new ID providers. I set new ID provider name as "nanasi" (because many zites mention this name) and the authorization menu on my zite shown an option to register new username with this provider. The destination zite that was opened was: http://127.0.0.1:43110/nanasi (invalid, does not contain .bit extension)

So in my zite code i changed ID provider name to "nanasi.bit".

When searching other zites, i found that many people mention "nanasi" (not nanasi.bit) as an ID provider. So my question if that is problem when i use nanasi.bit and other zites use nanasi ? What issues it can cause? Will it mean that my username that i will register with nanasi.bit will be incompatible with other zites that are using .bit less ID provider name (nanasi)?

When i changed ID provider name in my zite code, from nanasi to nanasi.bit, i no longer can switch to this identity provider (the menu item with my registered username@nanasi is grayed out as a result of changing nanasi to nanasi.bit in zite config.). (That may seem like [an issue](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1272) )

Which makes me doubt about my login compatibility between zites when ID provider name on one zite is nanasi and on other is nanasi.bit
My concern is that when someone @mention me, i should be in all cases notified to ZeroHello.
Another thing i do not understand is when same username is used by multiple people across different ID providers. When someone mention that username (@username), then all these people will get notified via ZeroHello?

Related reading from docs:
https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/cert_authority/#usage-in-contentjson
https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#certselect-accepted_domains

topic.title: Are big files re-downloaded after owner reorganize the zite?

topic.title: ZN corupted DB and Is it problem to restore main Zeronet's content.json?
topic.body:
Hello, I am talking about ZeroNet/data/content.json
My computer crashed and thus ZeroNet ended unexpectedly and after start ZeroHello said the database is rebuilding, but shown 0000 out of XXXXX that took a few tens of minutes, and Zites was not loading showing kind of db corruption error, so i quit ZN, restored my main content.json (around 3 weeks old), start it and zites were loading somehow, but newsfeed was not appearing even after more than hour and page refreshing, but after i restart ZN, newsfeed worked.

Now to the topic, I assume correct approach is to stop ZN, rename or move to recycle bin the main ZeroNet/data/content.json and start ZN to let ZN rebuild the DB, but on my 5400 rpm HDD it takes hours to rebuild it after i delete it and stat ZN. I think @nofish should make DB corrupt proof or different concept of the DB (more files?) so corruption  means rebuilding less data?

So what i did was i quit ZeroNet, then rename the ZeroNet/data/content.json file to content.json-date-corrupted and add move there my backup.

Question: Please what i will loose or what negative effect it can have to restore old ZeroNet/data/content.json instead of rebuilding the DB/content.json?

topic.title: Workaround making ZeroNet to download "big files" if it earlier was not DLed?
topic.body:
Hello, from [this post](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1305#issuecomment-374875560), it seems to me that if one decided to select zite option to "help distribute all files" in legacy zeronet versions (several months back), the ZN not downloaded "big files" and even after you later (in recent ZN versions) modified the limit for auto-downloaded optional files (under "help distribute all files" zite option), the ZN will not attempt to download big files that are missing.

That is how i understand it, i may be wrong. My question is if there is any manual workaround to make ZN download these big files without me deleting site and re-adding it? Maybe i can backup zite folder, delete zite from ZN, visit zite and then copy over sitehere/data/users contents so ZN do not have to re-download already downloaded opt. files and then tick option to help distribute all files? I have not tried this, thinking if there is more simple solution.

topic.title: How to find people with similar interests like yours on ZeroMe (or other sites)
topic.body:
It may be known to many, but while @Arkana asked on ZeroMe and i spent some time figuring answer, it may help to some when i post it here.
---

- How to find something on [ZeroMe](/1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH)?
- How to find people with similar interests like you on [ZeroMe](/1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH) so you can follow them?

You can use "Search in connected sites" search field on the [ZeroHello](/) and use search query like:
programmer site:ZeroMe
anime site:ZeroMe
(you can also search on ZeroTalk, just use "site:Zerotalk")

If you know someone's username (zeroid nickname) here on ZeroTalk or elsewere and you want to follow them, you can search example:
ssdifnskdjfnsdjk site:ZeroMe
(it will find such user posts, then go to his/her profile and follow him/her)

Easier would be if sites like ZeroTalk, ZeroMe has search field

topic.title: Pornography sites blocklist by ssdifnskdjfnsdjk
topic.body:
If you want to be warned/prompted before visiting pornography site, you can use this blocklist.
Note that you probably have to be running ZeroNet 0.6.3 Rev3495 or higher. To update your ZeroNet, go to [ZeroHello](/), next to the top left logo are three dots. It opens the menu where you can click your ZN version to update it.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/13CgSQeywg2ius5pjXVCk7dKUCRkz5xvW3/

If the blocklist does not working i assume:
a) you have not up to date ZeroNet
b) you already have that particular porn site on your HDD and you have to first delete it (from its (0) menu or from ZeroHello).

Note that when you open the blocked site and bypass the warning, you probably won't be warned again (unless you manually delete the site after your visit).

Which sites will/won't be listed in this blacklist:
NOT LISTED: nudity is just part of the content and user can decide whether to visit that sub-page
LISTED: nudity is on the homepage and or majority of the contents

----
Discussion about ContentFilter plugin which allows this public blocklists to work [is here](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1530020784_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K).

topic.title: Anyone on Windows 10 successfuly updated to Rev3542 ?
topic.body:
Hello, i see Rev3542 should be available (?) per https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commits/master
But when i click to update from [ZeroHello](/) ... menu (near zeronet logo), it restart ZN and i still see rev3540

I was also interested how i can manually update (running "python update.py" in Windows command line not worked). Thank you

topic.title: Difference between rebuilding DB from (0) menu and automaticaly after .db delete?
topic.body:
Hello,

i am rebuilding ZeroMe.db atm, i initiated it from the site's (0) menu (Rebuild button), it is one hour already and yet the popup that indicating progress not appeared yet. The ZeroMe.db is very slowly growing, it is 700KB after one hour. I remember when i deleted .db file when ZN was stopped and started ZN, the rebuild was usualy quite fast (done in a few minutes seeing progress on ZeroMe and on ZeroHello).

So, is there any difference (stopped ZN, deleted .db VS running ZN, rebuilt db from menu)?

PS: Nofish once suggested rebuild by deleting the .db file, unsure if there is any reason for that or it was first thing ot came to his mind. Indeed when i chosed the deleting way of rebuilding (stop ZN, delete file, start ZN, visit zerome, wait couple minutes, the rebuild started and took "just" ~15 minutes)

topic.title: How to setup ZeroMe hub so it is working?
topic.body:
Hello, [ZeroHello](/) search not returned any result to me and [ZeroNet docs](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) the same, so i ask here if anyone setup a hub by cloning existing ZeroMe hub and what was the steps to do in order hub be functional for both owner and the users?

[Here is](/185bkA3iwv1uuprQMbBCN37ArRDFPbnpBg) one such cloned hub with only increased user quota, if anyone want to try to join it and post something (i assume one have to have new zeroid identity - maybe thanks to multiuser plugin), i had no luck, publishing fails.

topic.title: * FILE UPDATE FAILED & "Needs to be updated:" - how to get rid of that?
topic.body:
Hello,

i have deleted some files from my zeronet site, specifically from my user folder and now in ZeroHello sites list it shows "123 FILE UPDATE FAILED" after clicking "Recheck" then when i open site's (0) menu, it shows: Needs to be updated:
and the list of files

How can i fix this so the site (content.json) no longer looking for these files. The site is the ZeroMe hub.

Btw. how different is to fix it for the site that is not mine, but where i am user?

topic.title: ZeroBlog clones/alternatives
topic.body:
What are the ZeroNet blogging systems that can be clonned?
I have found following blogs that seems to be either modified ZeroBlog or a new Content Management System.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BLogC9LN4oPDcruNz3qo1ysa133E9AGg8 - ZeroBlog (Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit) by nofish@zeroid
http://127.0.0.1:43110/15mSYzsDxzarssqtV1pFPKqoCTaLdjVB2f - ZeroBlog Plus (has [bug](https://snag.gy/42wOzU.jpg) with some images upload) by [Binchan](/1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1500038671) (binchan2@zeroid)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/19fZJhX7FGENeRRLB8ftgrziBJ5vsLtFog - ZeroBlog++ by [geekless@zeroid](/1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4gjkq4/1539001368)  (alows hotlinking images from other zites)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/12q9YNb5oJ331nTjUxWefV9W2EXpMu8RWi - ZeroBlog BlurHY (blurhy.bit)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1J2ZJjs97wEcW36x5d9f1QnPVPVDv8wbJ - Poster
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1JrT4VnMgpm6GgHV6R9yvgp5WkY8yTnRr7 - ZeroPress [by gtat314](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1557855329_1H2ao62jz8FK62H4VtDwHT1VW7hsyabqqX)

If anyone knows some details or interesting information about these blogs, or other modified or brand new blogging CMS, may be helpful to introduce it.

**How to clone blog to have your own?**
1. Open above mentioned sites and select one that looks the best and updated.
2. Go to [ZeroHello](/) and find appropriate blog in the list of sites
3. next to the blog name in the list, click three dots and then click to Clone ([here is](/1Kt7xxVRcxHcK14Mt7YZdXfh8MzUJMkvpk/images/how-to-create-a-blog-2.gif) the animation to illustrate)
4. when you got a question, create new ZeroTalk topic
5. advertise your blog on the [zite directories](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1524949682_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/ZeroNet+sites+directories)

topic.title: "TOR: ALWAYS" = active peer with "PORT: OPEN" ??
topic.body: Hello, is it possible to be active peer ("PORT: OPEN" on ZeroHello) when being in "TOR: ALWAYS" mode?

topic.title: When ZeroID.bit says "Recovering certificate from certs_9.json"
topic.body:
After one re-login at ZeroHello, and go to ZeroID.bit, it can be stuck at status: "Recovering certificate from certs_9.json"

[ZeroFrame] Status: Loading users data (2/2)... all.js:482:14
[ZeroFrame] Status: Searching for : UserPublicKey all.js:482:14
[ZeroFrame] Status: Recovering certificate from certs_9.json... all.js:482:14
[ZeroFrame] Possible optional file cert: @9,Usern UsernameHere all.js:482:14
[Show/hide message details.] TypeError: res is null

The cause of this can be that the site ZeroID is paused. Go to ZeroHello find the site in the list, find three dots menu after site name and "Resume".

topic.title: How to delete site of mine / own site?
topic.body:
So far i know how to empty it for me and for others (if i am correct):

1. visit the site, drag & drop its (0) button in the top right corner to show menu. There find the link to "OPEN SITE DIRECTORY".

2. Check it is indeed your site files, then delete all these and keep only content.json and index.html.

3. then edit and remove contents of the index.html file

4. go back to your site where you have open its (0) menu, here scroll down and click "Sign and publish", it should make your site empty (not deleted) and possibly ready for your other files you want to host.

topic.title: [solved] Lost my "follows" at ZeroTalk, editted users.json, but not helped
topic.body:
Hello, i see that my users.json, section for my identity that i am using and for zerotalk followed topics is missing topics i followed. Possibly i caused it by badly manipulating with the file.

So i tried to merge the lines (that indicate followed topics) from my backed-up users.json file to my live users.json file (while zeronet was closed) and it seems right in the file, but when i refresh zerotalk topic page that is supposed to be followed, i see the Follow button is not active (not following the topic).

Here is the appropriate section of the users json:

      "1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT": {
        "auth_address": "***",
        "auth_privatekey": "***",
        "cert": "zeroid.bit",
        "follow": {
          "Comments in this topic": [
            "SELECT 'comment' AS type, comment.added AS date_added, topic.title, commenter_user.value || ': ' || comment.body AS body, topic_creator_json.directory AS topic_creator_address, topic.topic_id || '_' || topic_creator_json.directory AS row_topic_uri, '?Topic:' || topic.topic_id || '_' || topic_creator_json.directory AS url FROM topic LEFT JOIN json AS topic_creator_json ON (topic_creator_json.json_id = topic.json_id) LEFT JOIN comment ON (comment.topic_uri = row_topic_uri) LEFT JOIN json AS commenter_json ON (commenter_json.json_id = comment.json_id) LEFT JOIN json AS commenter_content ON (commenter_content.directory = commenter_json.directory AND commenter_content.file_name = 'content.json') LEFT JOIN keyvalue AS commenter_user ON (commenter_user.json_id = commenter_content.json_id AND commenter_user.key = 'cert_user_id') WHERE row_topic_uri IN (:params)",
            [
              "1_1L4dZ***",
              "15140***_19***",
              "15129***_1L***"
            ]
          ],
          "New topics": [

I verified it is located under my masterseed that i am using as my primary identity.

What to try to apply the "follows" please?

_________

UPDATE: yes, wrong site address!! thank you :)

SIMILAR topic: [How to follow all my ZeroTalk topics (on Linux)](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1548412101_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+follow+all+my+ZeroTalk+topics+on+Linux)

topic.title: Where ZeroNet saves data about the ZeroTalk topics i am following?
topic.body:
Ok, it seems Zeronet forgot which topics i am following at ZeroTalk. When i visit my old topics, i see i am not following them.

Causes? i do not know, my ideas:
- ZeroNet bug
- using multiple zeronet versions for different OSes and one common /data dir
- HDD corruption
- computer sudden reset causing content.db malformed

Ok, i replied to someone elses topic and i am following it, i searched this topic number in ZN files to discover which file contains followed posts. I found only the record in 1TaLk***pT\data\users\*\data.json but that does not appear to indicate whether i follow the topic or not.

**Where ZeroNet saves data about the ZeroTalk topics i am following?** Can i somehow backup them and then once Zeronet again erase my followed topics, i can restore it manually by editting the file?

Anyone know a script/command that would exctract all my ZeroTalk topics and make me following them again?

- - - - - - 

**Update**: i found that the cause of this problem is missing multiuser_local attribute in zeronet.conf. On my previous PC i had this attribute set, but on new PC with new zeronet installation this attribute is not there by default. I do not understand why, but zeronet has problem - when the attribute is not set it logs me under some random identity logged out of all sites and even i log in under proper ID, it not assign my followed topics. But when the attribute is set, then it login me automaticaly under proper main Identity and i see i am following the topics.. @nofish

topic.title: Are You using "data_dir" ZeroNet config. option? Read this
topic.body:
Hello,

ZeroNet can be configured using zeronet.conf file and we can define custom path to the ZeroNet's data directory. Example i edit
C:\Apps\ZeroNet\zeronet.conf
and append new line, example:
data_dir = D:\ZeroNet\data

**Are You using "data_dir" ZeroNet config. option and are you on Windows?**
If yes, then note that there was a **bug** in recent ZeroNet versions (maybe ones that was in this month November 2018)!
This **bug possibly caused your data be removed from all sites** on which you participated during this bug being in place.
So if you updated Zeronet in Novemeber 2018 and having data_dir configurable option added manually in your zeronet.conf and you are on MS Windows, then you may have been affected. Make sure to:

1. update zeronet ([ZeroHello](/), three dots menu next to logo and click zeronet version number menu entry)
2. visit all important sites on which you participated during November and do some update action like updating your post, upvote, posting new content.
Especialy important sites like ZeroTalk, ZeroMe or others where you published alot of content.
3. If you modified your own site (Sign and publish) then the bug may caused you published "empty" content.json which indicate no site files. Your site may work locally, but others see no index.html error. So after updating zeronet to latest revision, go and again "Sign and publish" your site (example from its (0) menu).
4. Also this bug appears to caused others being unable to send you message on ZeroMail (they see error: "No publickey for user *"), so try to send [someone an e-mail](/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=SSDifnskdjfnsdjk) or delete some e-mails causing site to update your profile. That should allow others to contact you again :)

Bug details: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1790

topic.title: Links are broken when containing parenthesis character ")"
topic.body:
ZeroNet sites are using [markdown](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/markdown-Cheatsheet) to allow formating of the posts (bold text, italic text, bullet list...). When the URL/link markdown is used and the link URL contains the closing parenthesis:

[text]\(http://domain/name(abc).mp4)

then such markdown code will not create working link, here is how it will look like:

[text](http://domain/name(abc).mp4)

**To fix it**, replace:
abc**)**

by:
abc**%29**

simply the ) in the link have to be replaced by %29

result would be:

[text](http://domain/name(abc%29.mp4)

Another option is shorten the URL with parenthesis using [0sh.bit](/1GNTAKCimBv5xEnt7QvkDn8sTkEPj7ZYTL), but i have doubts if such shortened link will work for users who never visited 0sh.bit site (they do not have it downloaded). Zeronet if possible should indicate site downloading and then proceed going to the requested subpage.

topic.body:
I seen this a few times in __old__ ZeroNet's debug.log:

[2018-11-27 10:36:52,161] DEBUG    Site:*..* Bad files: {u'img/*.png': 20}
[2018-11-27 10:36:52,628] DEBUG    WorkerManager:*..* *iphere*:*port*: Verify correct: img/*.png
[2018-11-27 10:36:58,790] ERROR    - Unhandled exception
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "site-packages\gevent\greenlet.py", line 536, in run
  File "Z:\ZeroNet\core\src\Worker\Worker.py", line 91, in downloader

  File "plugins\Bigfile\BigfilePlugin.py", line 409, in write
    return super(SiteStoragePlugin, self).write(inner_path, content)
  File "Z:\ZeroNet\core\src\Site\SiteStorage.py", line 211, in write
    with open(file_path, "wb") as file:
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: u'Z:/ZeroNet/data/*/img/*.png'

(i placed asterisks for privacy)

I found that file on my HDD, and **that file could not be renamed, deleted and even copied**, has 0 byte size without create/modify time. The errors MS Windows shows:

a) Could not find this item. This is no longer located in X. Verify the item's location and try again.
b) The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect.
c) The system cannot find the file specified.

Zeronet is not running, filesystem is exFAT, i assume i should do error checking of the filesystem.

I did that, but somehow not seen result, it disappeared, and issue remains.

So i installed http://www.purgeie.com/delinv/dldelinv.htm app and that says this about file:
"Selected item has a problem with the Short Name. Delete/Rename may fail.
Selected File contains Reserved Name."

# SOLUTION
But, the **above mentioned DelInv app was able to delete the file** :)

After starting ZN and doing "Check files" next to that site, othen UPDATE 1 file con.png failed.

topic.title: How to create static site with big streamable videos
topic.body:
What is the quick and good **way to make videos embeded on my .html webpage optional**?

I only found this: https://zeronet.io/docs/site_development/content_json/#optional

# 1.
[create new zeronet site](/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/using_zeronet/create_new_site/) (click ... next to the logo on the top, "Create new, empty site"), open its directory (ZeroNet/data/siteaddress/) and add into content.json file:
"optional": ".\*webm|.\*mp4"

Another option is to make optional files just in particular directory (untested by me), like:
 "optional": "(data/.\*/.\*)",

# 2.
the ZeroNet/data/siteaddress/index.html file would contain following code to stream video files:
```<html>
<head><title>My video page</title>
<video controls="" height="250"><source src="video/file-name1.mp4" type="video/webm"></video>
<video controls="" height="250"><source src="video/file-name2.mp4" type="video/webm"></video>
</html>```

**Note** that
- the video file has to have proper audio, video codec to be streamable. mp4 x264 + aac is the most widely accepted i think; next one: webm VP9/8
- video tag has many parameters, for example:
`<video controls="" autoplay="" loop="" muted="" src="video/file-name1.mp4" type="video/mp4">This browser does not stream this video</video>`
controls - show volume, playback/pause buttons..
muted - mute sound
loop - automaticaly rewind and replay video

# 3.
After finishing site files modification, open the site and verify it works, then mouse drag & drop the (0) button to the left to open site menu, then scroll the menu to the bottom to "Sign and publish". Publishing new site may fail. You may need to first announce site on [0list.bit](/0list.bit) or [other direct0ries of zites](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1524949682_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) to get peers.

Do you have any improvement or fix to this "tutorial"?

topic.title: How to bulk edit all your username posts, comments on a site like ZeroTalk or other (moderate zerotalk)
topic.body:
This worked for me, though i may missed something or there is better way, please comment.

ISSUE:
- you add a typo in many posts of yours
- you want to replace some phrase or site address in all your posts/topics
- you are site admin and want to edit someone else's post text or topic title

How to do the replacing and not waste too much time by manually editing one post after another?

SOLUTION:
Here is an example on how to do it on ZeroTalk site, though it can work on other sites too

1. Open site and its (0) menu. The button in each zite top-right corner, mouse drag&drop that to the left
2. scroll the menu to find "Identity address" and copy it. Mine is: **1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS** (replace it by yours in following steps)
3. then scroll up the menu to find & click "Open site directory". In my case it opened C:\ZeroNet\data\1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT
4. i navigate to my user directory: data\users and find the directory that match my identity address i copied earlier.
5. inside i backup C:\ZeroNet\data\1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT\data\users\1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS\data.json (place backup to lets say your desktop, not in same directory as you may exceed your quota on that site) and then edit original data.json file using editor which has Search & Replace function.
6. do the replacement using that editor, in my case:
Search for: /Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit
Replace by: /1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT
6. Save the file and go again to the site (0) menu and on the bottom is a switch "This is my site", enable it and in "CONTENT PUBLISHING" field is content.json, i replace it by: data/users/1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/content.json
Then click "Sign and publish" and after i reload the page where is the post which contained old phrase, it was changed to new phrase, so it worked for me (hopefuly i did replacement correct and no side effect).

---
NOTE: maybe the step 6 can be replaced by just doing some on site action like liking someones post, which would cause publishing the changes?

topic.title: Linux bash script to periodicaly download sites recently added to "New ZeroNet Sites"
topic.body:
New ZeroNet Sites: [1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n](/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n)

Open editor:
$ nano /root/znnewsitesdl
(nano or vi), then paste:

\#!/bin/bash
ZERO_DIR=**~/ZeroNet-master**
APP_ID=1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n
SECONDS_BETWEEN_CHECKS=120

while true;do
sleep $SECONDS_BETWEEN_CHECKS
pkill -f siteDownload

NEW_SITES=$(sqlite3 $ZERO_DIR/data/$APP_ID/data/zerosites.db "select address from sites order by added desc limit 5;")

for SITE in $NEW_SITES; do
timeout 100 python $ZERO_DIR/zeronet.py --silent siteDownload "$SITE" 2>&1 >/dev/null &
done

done
#

_ _ _ _

Set executable permission: $ chmod 755 /root/znnewsitesdl

Install sqlite3 package: $ apt install sqlite3 2>/dev/null || yum install sqlite3 2>/dev/null

Open crontab:
$ crontab -e
Append new line to run it at boot:
@reboot /root/znnewsitesdl &

Start it immediately:
$ /root/znnewsitesdl &

_ _ _

It appears to be working and downloading X most recent sites every X seconds.
Error reports & ideas to improve are welcome.

---
Sidenotes:
1. you may host even bad sites (dr-ug traficking, f@ke news, p0rn..), would help to enable [blocklist](/1LgqZfbtr6dukbjHdjWBEmmthq1shEv3y1/)?
2. if you want to help seed many sites or want to also download new sites optional files (you are having tens/hundreds of GB free space), check [this topic](/16Go5kc2U9Ff4jeaY8kYiDEgpMYdgyboPY/?Topic:2_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+Install+and+run+Zeronet+on+a+Raspberry+Pi+or+any+Linux+computer) and search for "If you want to help seed" on that page.

topic.title: zeronet.py: error: unrecognized arguments: --multiuser_local
topic.body:
If you receive error:
zeronet.py: error: unrecognized arguments: --multiuser_local

It means in this case that the particular plugin called Multiuser is not enabled.

On Linux i enable it like this:
cd /home/ZeroNet-master
mv plugins/disabled-Multiuser plugins/Multiuser

topic.title: How to follow all my ZeroTalk topics (on Linux)
topic.body:
From time to time i find that i am not following some of my topics on zerotalk kind of site which i would like to follow. It already happened to me that i [lost my follows](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1541703899_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS).

Is there any API command, sql command that would do this?

So far here should be working manual way on how to follow all (tens or hundreds) topics. Though it is complicated and not easy for GUI user.

(1) find zeronet directory and its "data" sub-folder, enter the data folder and backup users.json file (contains sensitive important information regarding ones identities and also followed topics on various sites including zerotalk.

> cd /path/to/ZeroNet/data;cp -p users.json users.json_$(date --rfc-3339=date)

(2) then open original users.json file in graphical editor, find your identity section by searching your identity masterseed (on [ZeroHello](/) top bar buttons, click username button and show & copy masterseed)

(3) once masterseed found, search down the site address on which you want to follow all topics. In my case ZeroTalk: 1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT

it may be like second occurrence, where you see the section like:

     "1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT": {
        "auth_address": "***", 
        "auth_privatekey": "***", 
        "cert": "zeroid.bit", 
        "follow": {
          "Comments in this topic": [
            "SELECT 'comment' AS type, comment.added AS date_added, topic.title, commenter_user.value || ': ' || comment.body AS body, topic_creator_json.directory AS topic_creator_address, topic.topic_id $
            [
              "1_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS", 
              "1514096881_19WW28sn46rz9h15xf6NCELPdzxZ2YhbyB", 
              "1514127848_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS", 
              "1514146919_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS", 

last 4 lines is the list of topics we are currently following on ZeroTalk site. It contains also other people topics. The format can be different (all at one line).

(4) Remove occurrences that contain your public key (find yours in the URL of one of your topics). In next step we append complete list of your topics instead.

(5) Run Linux command:

> for i in $(grep -Rihs "_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS\\": \\[" /path/to/ZeroNet/data/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/data/|cut -d '"' -f2|grep '.\\{34\\}'|sort -u|grep -v Binary);do echo "\"$i\",";done

(can take some time, output should be all my topics)

_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS = my public key, find yours in the URL of one of your topics
1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT - address of the site for which i want to extract my topics_

(6) add the output to the place where we deleted own topics in step 3. Make sure all lines ends by comma (some will not end!!), except last line, example:

        "follow": {
          "Comments in this topic": [
            "SELECT 'comment' AS type, comment.added AS date_added, topic.title, commenter_user.value || ': ' || comment.body AS body, topic_creator_json.directory AS topic_creator_address, topic.topic_id $
            [
              "1_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS", 
              "1514096881_19WW28sn46rz9h15xf6NCELPdzxZ2YhbyB", 
             "1548336532_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS", 
              "1548241961_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k"  <- HERE
            ]
          ], 

you can paste 1 topic/1 line or all at one line, just keep syntax:
A) ["number_pubkey","number_pubkey"]
or B)
["number_pubkey",
"number_pubkey",
"number_pubkey"]
or combination

(7) Restart zeronet (on [ZeroHello](/) next to the logo is three dots menu where you click zeronet version)
I think publishing changes is not needed. Note that restart can cause writing something into users.json, so the best is to write changes when ZN is not running.

topic.title: Definition of the Zeronet fileserver port?
topic.body:

btw. this port can be set in zeronet.conf or on [/Config](/Config) page or as a [parameter to the zeronet launching command](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1535022026_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS):
`--fileserver_port port`
FileServer bind port (0: randomize) (default: 0)

`--fileserver_port_range port`
FileServer randomization range (default: 10000-40000)

topic.title: [tutorial] ZeroBlog - change number of posts per page
topic.body:
Sorry if this is duplicate, but if someone wondering how to change number of posts/articles per page on ZeroBlog (or its [clones](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1535186853_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS)), here is how:

1. open your zeroblog and move the (0) corner button to the left to open menu
2. click OPEN SITE DIRECTORY link
3. open js/all.js
4. find: limit = 15
5. replace by any limit of your choice
6. reload your blog page (F5) and click to publish changes button (i think doing some post title modification or uvoting would do the signing and publishing too)

topic.title: [tutorial] How to make all images, videos of my zite (zeroblog, etc.) OPTIONAL
topic.body:
This works possibly for all the zites.

**ISSUE:**
You are admin of the zeronet site and you see its size grows => New visitors is asked to increase site quota and download tens of megabytes => not good.

**SOLUTION:**
1. open your zite; mouse drag & drop (0) corner button to the left to open its menu in which you click the "OPEN SITE DIRECTORY" link

2. open content.json and add following new line after for example line  "modified": *,
 "optional": "(data/img/.*|data/vid/.*)",
alternatively to exclude all particular file types, no matter in which directory they are, try:
 "optional": ".*webm|.*mp4|.*flv|.*jpg",

2. Sign and publish changes

3. files copied to data/img/, data/vid will no longer be force downloaded by all new site visitors but become optional (will be loaded once visitor request the page that contain them).

- - -
Related topic: [How to create static site with big streamable vide0s](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1545035786_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS)

topic.title: Russia internet censorship of the VPN/proxy/Tor services?
topic.body:
What is the current status of the censorship in Russia regarding usage of the proxy services (VPN, Tor, ShadowSocks, I2P..)?

[Here](https://www.privateinternetaccess.com/blog/2017/07/russia-vpn-ban-doesnt-forbid-personal-business-use-vpns/) i read: "Simply put, Russia likely plans to block the domains of VPNs and proxies that don’t comply with Russian authorities to enforce their internet censorship filter. They could accomplish this goal by adding domains such as privateinternetaccess.com to the Unified Register of Prohibited Information – where the domains of over 100 VPN services already sit – and having ISPs, telecoms, and compliant VPN services, block access to the URL. The law does not prohibit personal VPN use and doesn’t specify use of any of the DPI techniques used by the Great Firewall of China – and Putin himself has indicated earlier this year at the G20 Summit that Russia will take a separate path from China in terms of internet censorship."

[2 years back, @ZAlex posted](/1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1LWuc6JBhUGrKEAh1aPrPU85dEMcKmg3pS/1492419881) following on his ZeroMe: "Roskomnadzor (the Russian Federal Agency responsible for censorship of the Internet) [asked](https://geektimes.ru/post/288166/) VPN providers to block sites that are banned in Russia."

So does Russia already enforced blocking of the domestic/foreign VPN providers sites who does not want to apply russia site blacklist? How Russians circumvent/workaround their state blocklist?

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_virtual_private_network_services

topic.title: Zeronet advertise zeroid.bit, zeronetwork.bit which is "single point of failure"
topic.body:
After nofish disappear (he does not yet at a time of writing) and his domains (zeronetwork.bit, zeroid.bit,zeronet.io...) [gets owned by a squatter & redirected](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1516098717_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS), what will happen?

Someone will fork github or gitcenter, (gitgud?) repository and register new domain (alternative to **zeronet.io**). Some people will find about this domain on clearnet groups like reddit, some will stop using zeronet because of dead zeronetwork.bit links. Those who find out about new zeronet domain will download new zeronet version which will fix ZeroHello non working zeronetwork.bit links hopefuly to real zeronet addresses.. (though zerotalk/me .bit links in sites .db's will remain causing not working links because of squatted .bit domain redirecting somewhere else). New ZN maintainer would have to create new site, possibly try to import old zerotalk db and fix the .bit links + advertise the site to new users in ZeroHello as nofish doing now.

Unsure how it would be with **zeroid**.bit. During id registration it relly on some single point of failure clearnet server i think - unsure if there is a source code for everything needed. Also unsure if squatted zeroid.bit 404 would cause problems for existing users on other zites that are using this identity provider. Am i wrong in my assumptions? Sorry if this is wrong to talk about this, but it bother me that some things are not decentralized and seem to relly on one person to be constantly available @nofish @polar @polar2 @krixano @git center: @gitcenter @tangdou @pubg

topic.title: How to edit comment/post on the zeronet site that does not allow editing
Terminology: Merger site | Merged site | hub site
topic.body:
@Krixano in [this post](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1553138703_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu#comment_753_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu) mentioned that the merger site, merged site, hub (site) is the same thing.

Before that i thought that merger site is a site that is merging sites called hubs.

For example @mcdev [here](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1548974921_18S47ArorYtHtcicjdGi6VZdhgJgwhrud7) is calling his site Millchan Engine a "merger site", which seems in collision with Krixano understanding.

[ZeroFrame API Reference here](/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#plugin-mergersite) says:
"mergerSiteAdd - Start downloading new **merger** site(s)."
"mergerSiteDelete - Stop seeding and delete a **merged** site."
from that i assume that zeronet developer/s (who may not be native english speaker) using words merger & merged for a hub, same as Krixano says.

So how to call a site that is "[merging](https://www.oxfordlearnersdictionaries.com/definition/english/merger?q=merger)"/utilizing hubs if not a merger/merging site? @krixano @gitcenter

- - - - -

merger parent site
merger child site

merger site
merger sub-site

topic.title: Upgrade from one ZeroBlog clone to other not added a "Settings" function into the blog sidebar
topic.body:
I upgraded my blog from @binchan2 ZeroBlog Plus to from @geekless ZeroBlog++ by editing my blog content.json and setting clonned_from to be geekless blog address. Then i manually backed up my site folder (because upgrade is known to replace some files deleting any modification in index.html and such). Then i ran Upgrade from within ZeroHello site list, three dots menu next to my site.

My blog sidebar was missing Settings button which is the feature of the destination ZeroBlog++. Here is what i did in order to manually fix it. But please read on because i think this is a BUG in upgrade process and should not happen.

- I tried to copy index.html from geekless blog, Settings button appeared and redirects to ?Settings:main, but it just show my blog index, like the function is not working.

- data-default/settings.json was missing, so i copied it over, but not helped

- data/settings.json was also missing in my blog, so i copied it also over from geekless blog, then Settings page asked me read permission to ZeroMe user registry which i granted.

- upon index page reload, it asked me Millchan permission, i granted. **Settings page shows blank content**

- after replacing css/all.css by one from original geekless blog, and doing Ctrl+F5 to reload Settings page, it started to show correctly, but unticking some option (hiding header image, hide it, but on reloading page, it is back there), i think it is still missing some files because zeronet failed to replace some file..? UPDATE: i think problem was in missing part of the database, because when i copied file **dbschema.json** from zeroblog++ to mysiteaddress/dbschema.json (replace) and did **rebuild and reload** command in my site's (0) menu (corner button), then onsite changes in Settings section **started to be saved 👍** (in db?).

topic.title: ZeroNet and RAM usage?
topic.body:
Hi, a few years back, [nofish was able to run zeronet on 512MB RAM computer](/1BLogC9LN4oPDcruNz3qo1ysa133E9AGg8/?Post:94). In the early 2019 @60: [here](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1553079752_1Ekf2tGQLhG3iifFsuUk9RcBPx26cQmCD1) reports that his zeronet eats 1.09G hosting 3K zites. I reported same figure. When i had 1500 sites hosted, the RAM usage was 960MB. + remaining 1GB was cache - python2.7 zeronet. I am wondering what would happen if i try same number of sites on 256 or 512MB RAM server py3. topic.title: How to blacklist/block zeronet identity provider/authority in content.json, but whitelist some of this ID provider certificates
topic.body:
There was an issue on [08chan zite](/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/), where the zite was using self-signed/onsite certificates "08chan" and also zeroid.bit ID authority/provider. Then due to SPAM, the owner disabled self-signed certs by removing line:
   "08chan": ["1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD"]

from data/users/content.json

& published the file. Causes? a **PROBLEM**: new visitors was unable to download /see the content once submitted by the users with the no longer allowed 08chan self-signed certificates...

**SOLUTION**? Admin again allowed self-signed certificates, but given these certs a zero quota on how much content they can publish (so he prevent new users using this identity wanting them to use zeroid.bit where the quota is high). And then specifically whitelisted all old users 08chan certificates in data/users/content.json: http://127.0.0.1:43110/131DjP88RMUo5v5twZDkD39wECdWZxzLtm/?1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS_2 (example code which lists two allowed 08chan certificates and shows that the remaining users of the 08chan identity has zero quota)

**RESULT**? 08chan old users can post and their content is visible to everyone, but new 08chan users gets a signing error that they are trying to publish bigger content than allowed (maximum allowed is 0 bytes ;) - so they have to use different ID provider - zeroid.bit in this case. Switching identity is done via site's menu (the corner button that is dragged to the left).

topic.title: This site requests permission: NOSANDBOX
topic.body:
> This site requests permission: NOSANDBOX
> Modify your client's configuration and access all site (Dangerous!)

Did you see such a message on some site? [Here is](/1NtQvrYd8rJzQYP3j1snmi28mPn8wSXX4X/?Page:zeronet-design---sandbox) an explanation about it and why you should NOT grant the permission.

quoting: "ZeroNet wraps every page served in a site by an IFrame, and then uses its sandbox attribute to limit what it can do, effectively sandboxing zites. ... lets sites deanonymize you ... an attacker can run any software on your computer, possibly stealing private keys and setting up a data locker ... That's why using NOSANDBOX is not recommended."

i think the author is @crazylime

Can nofish or someone else introduce some programming practice that would make new site developers to use function to hide or better delete (with delay) site's unseeded content by default? topic.title: How can ZeroTalk admin move/turn discussion topic into a group
topic.body:
ZeroTalk unfortunately does not yet allow ( https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroTalk/issues ) site owner to easily (via GUI) move topics into/between groups.
Group is something like a sub-forum. There is a selector for making new groups when creating new discussion topic.

So you being a zerotalk site clone owner, want to move one or more topics into or between groups. Here is how i did it:

1. open your zerotalk site's menu by moving top right corner button to the left and scroll down a bit clicking OPEN SITE DIRECTORY
2. in newly opened file manager, browse into data/users/ and go to directory of the user which topics/content you want to manage. You find the string when you mouse hover over the user name or topic title (in URL address)
3. in that user directory edit data.json file using some good editor (maybe you want to first backup original file).
4. in the file find the topic you want to move into a group. You will see the block of code like for example:

>			"topic_id": 1550302854,
>			"title": "...",
>			"body": "...",
>			"added": 1550302840

that is a code of the topic that does not belong to any group. You should turn it into example:

>			"topic_id": 1550302854,
>			"title": "...",
>			"body": "...",
>			"added": 1550302840,
>			"parent_topic_uri": "1578848017_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS"

we added parent_topic_uri which means we added it to the group. You can find correct group uri in the data.json which you are editting. Important is to notice that the previous line "added" must have new comma "," added at the end as it is no longer last line of the code block!

You can save the file and in the site's menu (corner button) click to "Rebuild" site database. Then reload the page (F5) to see if changes was made properly.

If everything is all right, you can sign and publish changes to other people (button should appear or do it from site's menu signing data/users/content.json)

PS: it seems to me that the group that has no topic is not visible (can be confusing)

Full error [here](/131DjP88RMUo5v5twZDkD39wECdWZxzLtm/?1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS_5) (waiting for the site to download and then page reload may be needed?)

When i prefix the python command with "sudo " then it works.

I am wondering if it is possible (how) to safely run zeronet without sudo?

What command to execute so i assign proper permissions. And i do not know if it is about permissions of some file or folder or permissions of a user account. Sorry i am not an expert.

This is Raspbian 10 (based on Debian?)

One may also permit python be ran by everyone, which may be security issue: sudo chmod u+s /usr/bin/python3

topic.title: How to password protect Zeronet server/proxy web interface
topic.body:
Maybe you are [running ZeroNet on a non-stop running server](/16Go5kc2U9Ff4jeaY8kYiDEgpMYdgyboPY/?Topic:2_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+Install+and+run+Zeronet+on+a+Raspberry+Pi+or+any+Linux+computer) and accessing zeronet interface via this server IP, for example: http://192.168.1.5/
Maybe you want to restrict the access only to yourself so no one else in same LAN or on whole internet, can access it. I know about two ways to do it:

**A)** password protect the zeronet web interface:

1 - move plugins/disabled-UiPassword to plugins/UiPassword
2 - into zeronet.conf paste new line below "[global]":
ui_password = yourpassword

Restart Zeronet. If not starting, check logs/ directory.
You can also define password as a process parameter (risky? users of same computers may see it?):
./zeronet.py --ui_password yourpassword

**B)** restrict access to zeronet proxy by IP. Append new line to zeronet.conf:
ui_restrict = IPaddressThatIsAllowedToAccessProxy

for multi IPs:
ui_restrict =
192.168.1.2
192.168.1.2

or just set it as a parameter:
./zeronet.py --ui_restrict 1.2.3.4 2.3.4.5 4.5.6.7

topic.title: ZeroNet 15441 port is only used for the Tor?
topic.body:
In ZN FAQ, both [clearnet](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/#do-i-need-to-have-a-port-opened) and [ZN based](/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/faq/#do-i-need-to-have-a-port-opened), i see is suggested to open the 15441 port, but is this port still used? I think for the incoming clearnet peer connections is used [random port generated on first ZN startup](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1915) (you can see the port on [/Stats](/Stats) and or on [/Config](/Config) or maybe under port button on the top of [ZeroHello](/)). But when i have Tor in "Always" mode (force peer connections thru Tor), then i see the [/Stats](/Stats) page shows this 15441 port and the public IP is the IP of some Tor exit node...
So i suppose i do not need to open this port anywhere despite the earlier mentioned FAQ page?

related: [why important to open the ZN port](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1509355895_1ALwbRLVTnHkqz8mCtWrHV1AsZLFkRhJj2#comment_1047_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj)

topic.title: Two zeronets/peers accessible via single public IPv4?
topic.body:
On the Linux server is zeronet and shadowsocks-libev server (proxy server)
On the Windows client is also zeronet and this zeronet is set (in zeronet.conf):
[global]
ip_external = 
 serverip
proxy = serverip:1234

to use that Linux server to connect the peers.
It appears to work and despite the server does not show the client's file server port amont open/listening ports ("netstat -tulnp" command), i see the client uploaded some traffic to the internet (maybe only to the Tor peers?).

I am wondering if it will work to use two zeronets via single IP. Maybe if server will use tor:always mode and client will use tor:enabled mode. Question is if zeronet will handle two peers on single IP.

And if i can open the client's fileserver port on the server somehow using iptables.

My thinking after reading [NAT manual](https://www.netfilter.org/documentation/HOWTO/NAT-HOWTO.txt) was to append rule into prerouting "chain(?)" of the NAT table for the connections to the port 1234 (client's ZN fileserver port) to be modified to go into server's shadowsocks port and hopefuly then forwarded to the shadowsocks client..
> iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -p tcp --dport 1234 -j DNAT --to 127.0.0.1:1082
likely that rule is wrong or useless. Anyhone have feedback please?

topic.title: Thoughts on setting Tor for Zeronet on Linux
topic.body:
Hi, i have installed ZN on various Linux distributions and i continue to face Tor errors in Zeronet

The documentation on how to setup Tor for ZN on Linux is not enough universal and newbie friendly i guess:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/faq/#how-to-make-zeronet-work-with-tor-under-linuxmacos
https://zeronet.io/docs/faq/#how-to-make-zeronet-work-with-tor-under-linuxmacos

So how to improve it?

My ideas:

Three commands to enter root terminal, adjust torrc file and exit root terminal session

sudo su

toruser="$(ls -l /var/lib/tor|tail -n1|awk '{print $3}')" && for var in CacheDirectoryGroupReadable CookieAuthFileGroupReadable DataDirectoryGroupReadable ExtORPortCookieAuthFileGroupReadable;do if [ "$(grep -v \"#\" /etc/tor/torrc)" != \*"$var 1"\* ];then sed -i "/$var/d" /etc/tor/torrc && echo "$var 1" >> /etc/tor/torrc;fi;done;sed -i "/User /d" /etc/tor/torrc && echo "User $toruser" >> /etc/tor/torrc;sudo sed -i "s|#ControlPort|ControlPort|g" /etc/tor/torrc;sudo sed -i "s|#CookieAuthentication|CookieAuthentication|g" /etc/tor/torrc

exit

then command to assign currently logged-in non-root(!) user to the tor group:

user=$(whoami) && sudo usermod -a -G debian-tor $user 2>/dev/null||sudo usermod -a -G tor $user 2>/dev/null;newgrp tor;systemctl restart tor

i think these commands are more universal and quick way to prevent zeronet/tor errors. Issue is that it is ugly and can be better if it is built in zeronet or something. Do you have better ideas or fixes?

I will then copy the result to [my ZN Linux installation tutorial](/16Go5kc2U9Ff4jeaY8kYiDEgpMYdgyboPY/?Topic:2_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+Install+and+run+Zeronet+on+a+Raspberry+Pi+or+any+Linux+computer).

topic.title: How to reuse Zeronet's Tor to browse the internet anonymously, can i?
topic.body:
On Windows, i was able to do it, but on Linux, somehow the
127.0.0.1:9050
127.0.0.1:9051
127.0.0.1:9150
127.0.0.1:9151
SOCKS5 set in web browser does not work (connection timeout).

UPDATE: the combination that loaded web page was:
127.0.0.1:9050, SOCKS5

But i had to edit /etc/tor/torrc file (uncomment SocksPort and set SOCKSPolicy accept 127.0.0.1). 
Command:

sudo sed  -i "s|#SOCKSPort 9050|SOCKSPort 9050|g" /etc/tor/torrc;sudo sed -i '1s;^;SOCKSPolicy accept 127.0.0.1\n;' /etc/tor/torrc;sudo systemctl restart tor;echo -e "---------\nSOCKS5 proxy should start working at hostname/IP 127.0.0.1 and port 9050 within couple of minutes once command \"systemctl status tor\" shows Bootstrapped 100%\n---------";sudo systemctl status tor|grep Bootstrapped

https://myip.ms then shows i am using Tor IP.
btw. one can use Firefox extension like [Sidebery](https://github.com/mbnuqw/sidebery/) to Tor proxy only defined list of sites, subdomains. (It is "Containers" tab in the extension settings). I have set \*.google.com, \*.gstatic.com for example to go via Tor. Google has much more domains though: https://github.com/nickspaargaren/no-google
In dev. console i am uinable to find out whether these sub-requests are really proxified. If anyone ahve idea how to verify that, please reply.

topic.title: Attempt to upgrade ZeroTalk clone to Zerotalk++
topic.body:
I did it by
1. backing up my site folder (zeronet-dir/data/mysiteaddress/) - important step because upgrade resets my site modifications (.css files, js files..)
2. modifying my site content.json file cloned_from variable to [1EgyL4nj9DmeSSQg3fytxGJjihxtmMon5y](/1EgyL4nj9DmeSSQg3fytxGJjihxtmMon5y) and then on [ZeroHello](/) page three dots menu next to my site name click Upgrade code
3. then the style/design was reset to match the mentioned site, but was wrong (wrong styling, missing css?), so in site's menu (top-right button moved to the left) click Rebuild database, and then reload database buttons. F5 refresh page. It looked fine now, but i think there could be issues because @geekless added some additional lines into main content.json and ZN's upgrade function not handling this

So what to do? Ideas:
A)
maybe just copy his site over mine except /data/users/... .db file and user folders inside it and except main content.json file and then manually compare his site main content.json file with mine and migrate only changed lines, except essential lines that must stay, for example these:

address
description
admin
admin_href
topic_sticky_uris
signers_sign
signs
title

B)
do the upgrade by changing cloned_from as described and then merge differences in main content.json file manually, focusing on lines containing variables shown above.

btw. [i tried to upgrade bl0g also in the past and also had the issue](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1556958529_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS)

topic.title: How i was setting up Tor+ZN v3 onion on Ubuntu 20.04
topic.body:
Thanks to [this tutorial](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1631033012_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8BdnSv3/How+to+setup+a+TOR+v3+tracker+on+Ubuntu+20+04+and+Linux+Mint+20+2+using+Anonymoose+s+patch), i have decided to order a 512MB RAM Ubuntu 20.04 VPS

First i wanted to change SSH port for safety increase:
vi /etc/ssh/sshd_config
un-comment line with port 22 and change to non standard number of your choice, like 14444

Then i have installed some additional packages:
apt update 2>/dev/null;apt upgrade 2>/dev/null;apt install whois htop nmon nload glances fail2ban 2>/dev/null
("glances" package seems to be bad as it is eating 10% of the memory (512MB i have on that VPS)).
Negative result of above apt upgrade etc. command was:
245 upgraded, 26 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
Need to get 310 MB of archives.
After this operation, 491 MB of additional disk space will be used.
Usage of /:   14.1% of 19.63GB
Memory usage: 37% of 512MB (after running Tor&ZN: 48%)

Then reboot and setup SSH password-less access runnign commands on my home PC: 
ssh-keygen
ssh-copy-id -p 14444 root@VPSIP

[Setup logs removal on the server](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1517258085_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+delete+all+standard+logs+on+a+Linux+server+regularly+to+keep+it+clean+of+logs)

Increase open files limit:
echo "* hard nofile 10000" >> /etc/security/limits.conf

Install Tor:
sudo apt install tor
tor --version  -->  Tor version 0.4.2.7.
echo -e "HiddenServiceDir /var/lib/tor/ZeroNet\nHiddenServicePort 15441 127.0.0.1:15441" >> /etc/tor/torrc
I had to also un-comment Tor controller port etc. and then reboot, else i was getting Tor error 111 permission:
sed -i "s|#ControlPort|ControlPort|g" /etc/tor/torrc;sed -i "s|#CookieAuthentication|CookieAuthentication|g" /etc/tor/torrc;sudo usermod -a -G debian-tor root 2>/dev/null
systemctl restart tor

Download zeronet (into user's home directory) and apply v3 onion patch (commands [suggested](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1627703143_17NZ2BiZ1HUYppUcUmU5bgyGkp8kH7UyXj#comment_36_12Y8rPJTMwJ3tTh5j81JPy6HrMf4KvY6Uq) by @anonymoose) :
cd ~/;git clone https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet.git;cd ZeroNet;git clone https://git.disroot.org/anonymoose/ZeroNet_OnionV3.git;cd ZeroNet_OnionV3;./install.sh;cd -

Install zeronet python modules (needed 200MB disk space :-/ may be better to install ZN bundle):
cd ~/ZeroNet;sudo apt-get install python3-pip -y;sudo python3 -m pip --no-cache-dir install -r requirements.txt

Zeronet works:
~/ZeroNet/zeronet.py --help

Since i have static IP and 24/7 server, i want to enable ZN tracker:
mv ~/ZeroNet/plugins/disabled-Bootstrapper ~/ZeroNet/plugins/Bootstrapper 2>/dev/null;mv ~/ZeroNet/core/plugins/disabled-Bootstrapper ~/ZeroNet/core/plugins/Bootstrapper 2>/dev/null

I wanted to allow world-wide access to my ZN web server at http://myvpsIP/ (command overwrites existing zeronet.conf if exist!):
echo -e "[global]\nfileserver_port = 15441\nui_ip = \*\nui_port = 80\noptional_limit = 90%\nautodownload_bigfile_size_limit = 200\nbigfile_size_limit = 1000" > ~/ZeroNet/zeronet.conf

To make zeronet start after Linux boot (run after making sure path is correct):
(crontab -l 2>/dev/null; echo "@reboot /usr/bin/python3 ~/ZeroNet/zeronet.py &") | crontab -

To start ZN if its not running & other suggestions, refer to [this](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1605116535_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/How+to+Install+and+run+Zeronet+on+any+Linux+server+like+Raspberry+Pi+zeronet+seedbox+public+proxy) tutorial

reboot # else i was getting Tor permission error

So ZN is now running for me, starts at boot, Tor inside it works, i see it have got one shared V3 onion tracker automatically:
zero://2kcb2fqesyaevc4lntogupa4mkdssth2ypfwczd2ov5a3zo6ytwwbayd.onion
on the [/Stats](/Stats) page under "Tor hidden services (status: OK (1 onions running)):" is:
global : stringhere"
cat /var/lib/tor/ZeroNet/hostname
otherstring.onion
(so these two strings does not match)
Later per the tutorial under 1st link i was instructed to add that .onion address to [/Config](/Config) like this:
File server port:
`15441`
File server external IP:
```
myserverIPhere
myonionaddressfromVarLibTorZeroNetHostname.onion:15441
```
Trackers:
`zero://myonionaddressfromVarLibTorZeroNetHostname.onion:15441`

Then i see that on ZeroHello, under Trackers i can see my tracker onion started being connectable (showing 100%) - at least on my side, unsure how to know my v3 tracker is being shared with other ZN users.

topic.title: ZeroNet web server collision with Nginx? It redirects to ZeroHello directory
topic.body:
Hello,
In zeronet.conf, i have set:
ui_port = 8080
and restarted ZN
ZeroNet works on http://myip:8080
I have installed Nginx web server and it is set to :80 (nano /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/*) yet, when i visit http://myip , it redirects to http://myip/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/ which is "404 Not Found" reported by Nginx.

I already made sure there is index.htm in /var/www/html
What works to show the custom page is to mkdir /var/www/html/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D and place the index.htm inside.

Do you have idea what to do to deactivate that redirect to 1HeLLo.. so i can serve custom index.htm at http://myip
?

topic.title: 08Chan - Site:1DdPHe..Vi9D data/users/useraddress/content.json: verify error: VerifyError: Include too large 1234B > 0B
topic.body:
After [switching to Zeronet-Enhanced](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1636133479_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) i have noticed quite alot of errors for many users of the [8Chan zite](/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/):

Site:1DdPHe..Vi9D data/users/**useraddress**/content.json: verify error: VerifyError: Include too large 5768B > 0B in ContentManager.py line 1025 > 997 > 901 > 917

site's data/users/content.json file is last modified numerous months ago and contains:
  "optional": null,
  "permission_rules": {
   ".*@08chan": {
    "files_allowed": "",
    "files_allowed_optional": "",
    "max_size": 0
   },

while zeroid has "max_size": 5000000

i remember that due to SPAM they disabled these self signed @08chan identities, so that is the reason likely - i am having user directories which have self signed identities and these no longer match site size criteria... My debug.log contains 2177 of these lines, /Config i set to log Only important message.

Not sure if i can do something about this. If i somehow delete these users directories, their content will be lost.

**Update**: it seems that the directories are deleted, site files ZeroHello recheck, verify, content.db rebuilt, but still these errors, ideas?

At this point i think i should submit an issue on bug tracker.. no one have this issue for this particular site (1DdPHe... 8chan)? In the meantime i have [switched](/Config) to logging only errors.

1517491463_1PyrAjbZiHyfW7jSWeUpDPSeMU7sA.body:
Starting with Firefox 59, several protocols that support decentralized architectures are approved for use by extensions.  The newly approved protocols are:

    Dat Project (dat://)
    IPFS (dweb://  ipfs://  ipns://)
    Secure Scuttlebutt (ssb://)

Firefox itself does not implement these protocols, but having them on the approved list means the browser recognizes them as valid protocols and extensions are free to provide implementations.

--

1518461623_1R67TfYzNkCnh89EFfGmXn5LMb4hX.body:
I do not know the answer, @nofish but i found some interesting related info:

[There](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/955#issuecomment-304474854) i read following text dated May 2017: "ZeroNet network protocol is not a Pluggable Transport protocol. The protocol itself is not yet "blocking resistant," as Wiley puts. Without Tor, ZeroNet does not make you anonymous, either. There are a lot of research and programming to be done. I believe Tamas does not have the funding or resources to implement Pluggable Transports or to make ZeroNet protocol indistinguishable. The community do not ignore this issue, but for the time being, the community always recommend you use Tor Always mode."

"An increasing number of censoring countries are using Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) to classify Internet traffic flows by protocol. While Tor uses bridge relays to get around a censor that blocks by IP address, the censor can use DPI to recognize and filter Tor traffic flows even when they connect to unexpected IP addresses. ... Pluggable Transports (PT) transform the Tor traffic flow between the client and the bridge. This way, censors who monitor traffic between the client and the bridge will see innocent-looking transformed traffic instead of the actual Tor traffic."
Source: https://www.torproject.org/docs/pluggable-transports.html.en

Can China's GFW block the zeronet ? https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/506
When Tor is blocked by goverment https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/717

1518515398_14UupgrdnT7Y8vMES7aqUFgD1fC5R.body:
> Tor is sometimes(well,too often) very slow,and makes clearnet browsing enjoyable.

My post is regarding **questionable security of using Tor to browse clearnet.**

i read it is not secure to use Tor for clearnet browsing for the reason that Tor exit nodes can be malicious and read non-HTTPS POST requests (login data or other sensitive data) or even redirect you to a fake/phishing site. I do not know if/how it is doable, but see a few quotations:

> "The bottom line is that the exit node can see traffic from some tor user to the clearnet site, and if it's not https/SSL then it's in the clear."

> "Exit nodes are like ISPs they can see your unencrypted traffic too."

> "In the past, some exit relays were documented to have sniffed and tampered with relayed traffic. The exposed attacks included mostly HTTPS man-in-the-middle (MitM) and SSL stripping. ...  Since September 2013, we discovered 65 malicious or misconfigured exit relays which are listed in Table 1 and Table 2 in our research paper. These exit relays engaged in various attacks such as SSH and HTTPS MitM, HTML injection, SSL stripping, and traffic sniffing." [source](https://www.cs.kau.se/philwint/spoiled_onions/)
 -
So i got impression it is not secure to freely use TorBrowser for clearnet browsing, but instead use it for anonymization and be careful about HTTP only sites (sites without HTTPS) so one do not submit too sensitive data (login data) there, fortunately it seems to be very rare case when some site do not offer HTTPS (even self signed certificate).

If anyone want to react, [here is](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1518526043_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/Are+the+risks+of+malicious+Tor+exit+nodes+too+big+to+use+Tor+for+clearnet+browsing) also the topic about this security issue.

On the bottom of the ( 0 ) menu of your zite, there may be possibility to select not just content.json but also  data/users/content.json and you may also enter custom path to your username directory (data/users/useraddress/content.json) and sign, publish changes of that .json file. But i doubt it can help fix it. I think zeronet posts may be located in ...zeronet\data\siteaddress\data\users\zerotalk.db
I use Ctrl+F5 to reload page fully.
See if anyone else can reply who understand it..

Site shows: Initial sync in progress...
Submitting topic result in: File write error: Forbidden, you can only modify your own files

Someone mentioned following regarding that error:
Access rights are not enough. Apparently, put from one user, and you start from the other.
It is necessary or to change the rights for the user you need, such as:
sudo chown <user> ZeroNet -R
or give everyone the right to write:
chmod a + w ZeroNet -R

UPDATE: it is OK now

There is new button to open the directory with your (or currently visited) site files.
1. Open the zeronet site (you can find your site in [ZeroHello](/) menu)
2. in the top right corner of your site is ( 0 ) button, drag & drop this button to the left to show menu
3. There is number of peers and Data transfer. Under Data transfer is the link "OPEN SITE DIRECTORY"
You should backup this whole directory to some location outside ZeroNet folders. Site should have index.html and [content.json](https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/content_json/#structure-of-contentjson)

China (and russia?) already **blocked famous torrent trackers** which ZeroNet also was using - [read here](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1522317542_1FenK9SJK21haGBvxM7vZNCLp1Z9hsCWUc), someone talking [about DHT](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/57) which eliminate trackers

**China blocks Tor** (from what i read) so it hurts anonymizing function of the ZeroNet for these users, they have to use VPNs / ShadowSocks R
**Project is maintained by single person**

1524573807_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5.body:
i am quoting a nice explanation by kaffie. She talks about the SunHub which is a zerome hub. Question was under which conditions ZeroNet will download SunHub (and its users and their content) in case i am on a different zerome hub. The answer was:

There's two ways zeronet will download sun hub and it's content.

1. You visit a sunhub user's zerome profile, and there's a button to click to download it.

2. You visit the sunhub zite directly and it'll download like any other zite.

Each zerome hub contains: user profiles+posts+followed users (the stuff you see when you visit someone's profile), and then the comments on posts that were posted to that hub. So for instance if you check the sunhub moonhub folder you'll see all of these comments are in there. That way people only need sunhub moonhub to see the entire conversation here, rather than needing several different hubs.

[src](/1MeFqFfFFGQfa1J3gJyYYUvb5Lksczq7nH/?Post/1MoonP8t4rk9QamBUPh5Aspkwa1Xhf5ux2/1KkQmWnbZatijrNzgs4qtyyYcAXyEt3qgr/1551040809#)

1524589266_1KDRKDBSjdQmoGoQo3fdCHia7mp2G.body: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cannabis_use_disorder#Signs_and_symptoms) says "Cannabis withdrawal symptoms can occur in one half of patients in treatment for cannabis use disorders. These symptoms include dysphoria (anxiety, irritability, depression, restlessness), **disturbed sleep**, gastrointestinal symptoms, and decreased appetite. Most symptoms begin during the first week of abstinence and resolve after a few weeks.[6]"

"Progression of Marijuana Use

- Experimentation, trying a substance for the first time, and occasion
- Social- no pattern, minimal impact
- Habituation- established pattern of use
- Abuse- pattern of use and continued use despite negative consequences
- Addiction- continued use despite negative consequences, compulsion to use, loss of control, withdrawal, and desire to use again after withdrawal."
